title: South Korea cuts policy rate, as expected, to prop-up economy
text:
South Korea cuts policy rate, as expected, to prop-up economy

Economy 9 minutes ago (Oct 15, 2019 09:06PM ET)

SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea's central bank cut its policy interest rate for the second time in three months on Wednesday, as expected, to support a slowing economy and address mounting deflationary pressures. The Bank of Korea's monetary policy board trimmed the base rate by 25 basis points to 1.25%, a media department official said. BOK Governor Lee Ju-yeol is due to hold a news conference from 0220 GMT. The rate cut follows a July easing and was in line with forecasts in a Reuters survey of 31 analysts. The new rate matches a record low seen until late 2017.
